name: Lentil Salad With Walnut Oil
description: This dish is inspired by a recipe from “The Paris Cookbook,” by Patricia Wells. I’d never thought about using walnut oil, which is high in omega-3 fats, with lentils. It’s a great combination. Be sure to keep walnut oil in the refrigerator once it’s opened.
keywords: french green lentils, vegetables, walnut oil, healthy, vegan, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 2 cups green Le Puy lentils, washed and picked over
2 tablespoons red wine vinegar or sherry vinegar
1 shallot, minced, or 1 garlic clove, minced

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the lentils, garlic, bay leaf, onion, carrot and water in a large saucepan or Dutch oven. Bring to a boil. Add salt to taste (1 to 2 teaspoons), reduce the heat to low, cover and simmer 35 to 45 minutes until the lentils are tender. Remove from the heat. and discard the onion, carrot, garlic cloves and bay leaf. Drain through a strainer set over a bowl.

Whisk together the vinegar, Dijon mustard, salt and shallot or garlic. Whisk in the oil and 2 to 4 tablespoons of the liquid from the lentils. Stir into the lentils. Add the parsley and pepper, and taste and adjust salt. Spoon onto plates, arrange walnuts on top of the lentils, and serve.
